column7: The cell body houses the nucleus and the DNA and produces energy.
column8: Dendrites extend from the cell body in a fractal like pattern, in clusters called arbors. They also receive information from the axons of other neurons.
column9: Axons can be tremendously long. They transfer information to the dendrites of other cells-- and the speed of information transfer depends on whether they are mylenated or 'naked' (unmylenated).
column10: The glial cells, far in number as they are, nurture the neurons. They guide the neurons to their proper location in their early stages and support them during course of their lives. A potential 'function', if you will, for a glial cell is to be the source of a brain tumor because glial cells unlike neurons can continue to divide.

column7: The cell body contains DNA.  The cell body contains energy producing organelles.  The cell body contains the nucleus. The cell body resembles a city hall.
column8: Dendrites function as receivers, collecting chemical and electrical signals.  Dendrites branch from the cell body.
column9: Axons can extend very long distances.  Axons carries electric signals from one neuron to the receiving dendrite of another neuron (minding the synapse). Axons are can be wrapped in glial cells.
column10: Glial cells quicken the pace of information transfer. Glial cells work in conjunction to neurons.
column11: Astrocytes are glial cells. Astrocytes are part of the central nervous system.

column7: It contains the nucleus.  Location of cell body is how neurons are classified as being a part of the Central or peripheral nervous system. It contains the mitochondria. It is where proteins are made.
column8: They branch out and form dendrite trees.  Information is received by neuron through dendrites.
column9: There is only one per neuron.  It sends out information to synaptic terminals.  It can be myelinated or not.
column10: Clean up and recycle.  10 to 1 ratio of glial cells to neurons. Crucial for cell development because they form the scaffolding needed for proper transmission of signals.
column11: They are the workhorses They clean up They ensure that synapses are well formed.
